intro: Lachemilla mutisii, commonly known as the Andean mossy cushion, is a low-growing evergreen plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-like growth habit, forming compact cushions of foliage. The plant features small, rounded leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white, woolly hair, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, Lachemilla mutisii is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
